intro: Stomarrhena serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated leaf stoma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, serrated leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecology.
